commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: 4 wins, 4 losses each and a tie. So what do we do now?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: This is usually when we go into overtime.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Hmm. Isn't it enough, already?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Wasn't this supposed to be about showing them the Secret Idol Handbook, not proving we're better than them?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: That means a tie should be more than enough. Everyone from Nijigasaki was amazing, and doing all of these contests was fun!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: That's right. We've competed against other schools, but never like this before.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Plus, we were the ones that proposed the competition in the first place. I actually feel bad for dragging them through all of this.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Honoka, Eli, Umi...

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Here. Take it.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Huh? I-Is this...

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: The Secret Idol Handbook you wanted to read. I have a lot I want to say, but a tie is way better than I thought you'd do, so I think you're pretty amazing.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: This is proof of my approval. Burn the contents of this into your brains and use the information to be better idols.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: What? Hurry up and take it.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Sorry... I can't.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Excuse me?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Can you let us finish this to get a real verdict? Honoka may be right in that it's not about who's better, but...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: But something just doesn't feel right about letting this end at a tie! I'm sorry if this is selfish.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I agree! I call a rematch with Nico!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Yeah, a draw hardly provides an acceptable conclusion.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: It feels so much better to have a clear winner and loser!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I feel the same. I find this hard to swallow as is.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: If we do another fashion show, I'll draw better!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: I'd rather not obsess over winning and losing, but I think determining a clear winner and loser will help us move on to the next step.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I don't care much either way.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Last week and today were like parties. It was all so fun! If it's going to bring us closer together, I'm all for continuing this.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: M-Me too. If it helps everyone, I agree.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You guys...

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Hmm... Right. Okay.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: I understand what you guys are saying, but to be honest I'm not that concerned with who wins and loses.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: I already said I'd show you the Secret Idol Handbook. Personally, though, I've got a thing or two to say about that ninth contest.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Hey, how about this?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Nozomi?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: There's a music event at the end of the month we're thinking about entering. Are you guys at Nijigasaki entering too?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: At the end of this month? No, we haven't registered or anything.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: I see. Then you should.

commands.speaker: Everyone
commands.line: What?!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: So we're going to determine the final winner at this event?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Nope. We're both going to write new songs for the event and compare them. The better song wins and the members get to enter the event.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Wha?! Wh-What are you saying?!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Sounds interesting.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Honoka?!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: It's a song battle! It's the clash of the conviction of school idols! How cool is that?

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Actually, that makes it wonderfully dramatic.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: What do you think? If it's a contest of song writing, that means you'll be participating.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah, I'll do it!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Oh! Things are heating up!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: So it'll be a contest of a school idol's core essence!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I felt like we were testing important facets of school idols the whole time.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: No need to worry about the details!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: It's a shame we can't get a rematch of the ninth contest, but if we win this, we'll snatch the chance to enter this event from μ's.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: That's a blunt way to put it. This kind of competition sure fires me up though.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Yes, my heart is pounding in anticipation.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I can't wait for this event.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: *Giggle* So Nijigasaki agrees. What do you think, Maki?

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Why would you ask after getting everyone so excited? I don't mind. I'm curious to see what kind of song you can write, too.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Maki...

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: So that's it. The final day for entries is exactly two weeks from today. Let's make the song-off the day before that.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'm looking forward to it!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Then overtime it is. The tenth contest between μ's and Nijigasaki, a song-off!
